messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Suggestion (may I?)
messages.msgSnippet: ***Can I  suggest that we start a database of recommended books that everyone can enter into? *** You can find a list of books at the forum home page under
messages.messageBody:
***Can I suggest that we start a database of recommended books that
everyone can
enter into? ***

You can find a list of books at the forum home page under Resources.
Here's the link to the books page:
http://www.unschooling.info/books.htm

Here's the link to the Resources page:
http://www.unschooling.info/resources.htm

And if you've never been there, here's a link to the message boards:
http://www.unschooling.info/forum/

And, (should have been first, but...) the home page from which you can
get to all those other cool places:
http://www.unschooling.info/index.html


Deb Lewis

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Suggestion (may I?)
messages.msgSnippet: ... People are welcome to check out (and crib) the database section over at AlwaysUnschooled, which I keep pretty much up to date with member
messages.messageBody:
Christy Putnam wrote:

> I was just about to do a library search for some of the other books I have
> seen mentioned here and I realized I couldn't remember who poster(s) were.
> That got me thinking...do they have a list of recommended books on
> unschooling in the files section. So I looked and nothing is there.
> Can I
> suggest that we start a database of recommended books that everyone can
> enter into? That way, when a person posts about a book they
> recommend, they
> can put it in the database for future use.


People are welcome to check out (and crib) the "database" section over
at AlwaysUnschooled, which I keep pretty much up to date with member
recommendations.

We've done a monthly book discussion in the past, but with my move and
then the holidays, it's gotten way off track. I need to yank it back on
track this month. Rue's book is coming up, I think. You can access that
list by clicking "calendar" then "event list".

--
~~Danielle
Emily (8), Julia (7), Sam (5)
http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

"With our thoughts, we make the world." ~~Buddha

messages.subject: Suggestion (may I?)
messages.msgSnippet: I was just about to do a library search for some of the other books I have seen mentioned here and I realized I couldn t remember who poster(s) were. That got
messages.messageBody:
I was just about to do a library search for some of the other books I have
seen mentioned here and I realized I couldn't remember who poster(s) were.
That got me thinking...do they have a list of recommended books on
unschooling in the files section. So I looked and nothing is there. Can I
suggest that we start a database of recommended books that everyone can
enter into? That way, when a person posts about a book they recommend, they
can put it in the database for future use.

In Gratitude,

Christy Putnam
<http://blog.myspace.com/personal_balance>
http://blog.myspace.com/personal_balance


Independent Executive
